sources.title: Agent 38-24-36 (1964) an Édouard Molinaro comedy film | with Brigitte Bardot | Colorized Movie
sources.description:
It's spy-tacular! - Here comes Brigitte Bardot as the wildest secret agent who ever dropped the Iron Curtain on her foot!
Harry Compton, a naive young man, is dismissed by the bank in which he worked. Desperately in need of a job, he agrees to become a Soviet spy. Too foolish to succeed on his own, his girlfriend tries to help.

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/PnLvQz--Eig


Original title: Une ravissante idiote (1964) AKA: The Ravishing Idiot / The Adorable Fool / Agent 38-24-36 

This film is available with French & Russian audio, and subtitles in many more language options

Director: Édouard Molinaro
Writers: François Billetdoux, Charles Exbrayat, Édouard Molinaro
Stars: Brigitte Bardot, Anthony Perkins, Grégoire Aslan
Genre: Colorized Classics, Comedy, French Cinema.

@CultCinemaClassics 

Members-only videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

metadata.Plot: Harry Compton, a naive young man, is dismissed by the bank in which he worked. Desperately in need of a job, he agrees to become a Soviet spy. Assigned with the mission to steal the "Avalanche" secret file from Sir Dumfrey, he gets to know Penny, a ravishing but somewhat dumb dressmaker. The young woman spontaneously offers to help Harry in his actions. But they are pursued by bad luck. What's more, they keep accumulating blunders. To make matters worse, the MI6 has learned of the operation...
metadata.Writer: François Billetdoux, Charles Exbrayat, Édouard Molinaro
metadata.Actors: Brigitte Bardot, Anthony Perkins, Grégoire Aslan
